info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 6:49AM CDT until June 12 at 11:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 AM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN COMANCHE...SOUTHWESTERN GRADY...SOUTHEASTERN CADDO AND NORTHWESTERN STEPHENS COUNTIES... At 648 AM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 3 miles northwest of Cement to 4 miles southwest of Sterling, moving east-southeast at 45 mph. The strongest storm was located just west of Sterling, and this storm produced golf ball size hail in Elgin. HAZARD...Golf ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Duncan, Anadarko, Marlow, Elgin, Apache, Rush Springs, Fletcher, Cyril, Sterling, Cement, Norge, Agawam, Lake Ellsworth, eastern Fort Sill, Central High, Ninnekah, Acme, Stecker, and Laverty. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...OBSERVED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
